citation.article-title: Aequorivita gen. nov., a member of the family Flavobacteriaceae isolated from terrestrial and marine Antarctic habitats.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Aequorivita lipolytica sp. nov.
Aequorivita lipolytica (lip.o.ly'ti.ca. Gr. n. lipos fat ; Gr. adj. lytikos dissolving; N.L. fem. adj. lipolytica fat-dissolving)
The description is the same as that of the genus unless specified otherwise.
Cells appear as straight rods (0.5-3.0x0.4-0.5 μm), which occur singly or in pairs.
Forms bright-yellow colonies.
Requires sodium ions for growth (at least 0.5% NaCl).
Tolerates 6% NaCl, but not 10% NaCl.
No growth occurs in the presence of 1% ox-bile salts.
Detectable levels of acid are not produced from carbohydrates nor do strains utilize dglucose as a sole carbon and energy source in the presence of 0.02%yeast extract.
Arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase and ornithine decarboxylase are negative.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Hydrogen sulfide is not formed from L-cysteine.
Hydrolyses aesculin, ltyrosine (no diffusible pigment), Tween 80, gelatin, casein and elastin.
Strains may also hydrolyse urea.
Unable to hydrolyse agar, starch, cellulose, CMC, xylan, dextran, DNA, urate or xanthine.
Tributyrin is hydrolysed and lipase (olive oil) and lecithinase are also produced.
Produces an alkaline phosphatase.

The following glycosidic enzymes are not produced: aglucosidase, α-galactosidase, α-arabinosidase, β-galactosidase, 6-phospho-β-galactosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-fucosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.
The G+C content of cells is 35-36 mol%.
The type strain is strain Y10-2T (=ACAM 641T=DSM 14236T), which was isolated from sea water of the Mertz Polynya, Antarctica.
